meanings.definition: The quality or state of being variable.
meanings.sent1: The variabilities in the weather make it hard to predict.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the variabilities in the experiment results.
meanings.sent3: The variabilities in the student's excuses for not doing homework were quite creative.
meanings.sent4: Her mood swings showed variabilities that were like a rollercoaster.
meanings.sent5: The variabilities in the color of the leaves in fall are beautiful to see.

meanings.definition: The range or extent of differences within a set of data.
meanings.sent1: The variabilities in test scores were noticeable.
meanings.sent2: Analyzing the variabilities in stock prices is crucial for investors.
meanings.sent3: The variabilities in the flavors of ice cream made choosing one a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: The variabilities in opinions on the movie were vast.
meanings.sent5: The variabilities in the sizes of the fish caught amazed the fishermen.
